In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SOEs provided by third parties are scanned for malicious code and configurations.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SOEs are reviewed and updated at least annually.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that ACSC and vendor guidance is implemented to assist in hardening the configuration of operating systems.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unneeded accounts, components, services and functionality of operating systems are disabled or removed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Default accounts or credentials for operating systems, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Automatic execution features for removable media are disabled.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Internet Explorer 11 is disabled or removed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that .NET Framework 3.5 (includes .NET 2.0 and 3.0) is disabled or removed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Operating system exploit protection functionality is enabled.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Early Launch Antimalware, Secure Boot, Trusted Boot and Measured Boot functionality is enabled.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unprivileged users are prevented from bypassing, disabling or modifying security functionality of operating systems.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unprivileged users are prevented from running script execution engines, including:
• Windows Script Host (cscript.exe and wscript.exe)
• PowerShell (powershell.exe, powershell_ise.exe and pwsh.exe)
• Command Prompt (cmd.exe)
• Windows Management Instrumentation (wmic.exe)
• Microsoft Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) Application Host (mshta.exe).?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unprivileged users do not have the ability to install unapproved software.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unprivileged users do not have the ability to uninstall or disable approved software.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Application control is implemented on workstations.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Application control is implemented on internet-facing servers.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Application control is implemented on non-internet-facing servers.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Application control restricts the execution of executables, software libraries, scripts, installers, compiled HTML, HTML applications and control panel applets to an organisation-approved set.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Application control restricts the execution of drivers to an organisation-approved set.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Application control is implemented using cryptographic hash rules, publisher certificate rules or path rules.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Application control rulesets are validated on an annual or more frequent basis.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When implementing application control using publisher certificate rules, both publisher names and product names are used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When implementing application control using path rules, only approved users can modify approved files and write to approved folders.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When implementing application control using path rules, only approved users can change file system permissions for approved files and folders.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft’s ‘recommended block rules’ are implemented.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft’s ‘recommended driver block rules’ are implemented.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that All users (with the exception of local administrator accounts and break glass accounts) cannot disable, bypass or be exempted from application control.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Allowed and blocked execution events on workstations are logged.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Allowed and blocked execution events on internet-facing servers are logged.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Allowed and blocked execution events on non-internet-facing servers are logged.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Application control event logs are stored centrally.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Windows PowerShell 2.0 is disabled or removed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that PowerShell is configured to use Constrained Language Mode.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that PowerShell is configured to use module logging, script block logging and transcription functionality.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that PowerShell script block logs are protected by Protected Event Logging functionality.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Blocked PowerShell script execution events are logged.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that PowerShell event logs are stored centrally.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A HIPS is implemented on workstations.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A HIPS is implemented on critical servers and high-value servers.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A software firewall is implemented on workstations and servers to restrict inbound and outbound network connections to an organisation-approved set of applications and services.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Antivirus software is implemented on workstations and servers with:
• signature-based detection functionality enabled and set to a high level
• heuristic-based detection functionality enabled and set to a high level
• reputation rating functionality enabled
• ransomware protection functionality enabled
• detection signatures configured to update on at least a daily basis
• regular scanning configured for all fixed disks and removable media.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that If there is no business requirement for reading from removable media and devices, such functionality is disabled via the use of device access control software or by disabling external communication interfaces.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that If there is no business requirement for writing to removable media and devices, such functionality is disabled via the use of device access control software or by disabling external communication interfaces.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that External communication interfaces that allow DMA are disabled.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The following events are logged for operating systems:
• application and operating system crashes and error messages
• changes to security policies and system configurations
• successful user logons and logoffs, failed user logons and account lockouts
• failures, restarts and changes to important processes and services
• requests to access internet resources
• security product-related events
• system startups and shutdowns.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Operating system event logs are stored centrally.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that User applications are chosen from vendors that have demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The latest release of office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Default accounts or credentials for user applications, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that ACSC or vendor hardening guidance for web browsers, Microsoft Office and PDF software is implemented.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unneeded components, services and functionality of office productivity suites, web browsers, email clients, PDF software and security products are disabled or removed.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Add-ons, extensions and plug-ins for office productivity suites, web browsers, email clients, PDF software and security products are restricted to an organisation-approved set.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office is blocked from creating child processes.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office is blocked from creating executable content.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office is blocked from injecting code into other processes.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office is configured to prevent activation of Object Linking and Embedding packages.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Office productivity suite security settings cannot be changed by users.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Web browsers do not process Java from the internet.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Web browsers do not process web advertisements from the internet.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Internet Explorer 11 does not process content from the internet.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Web browser security settings cannot be changed by users.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that PDF software is blocked from creating child processes.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that PDF software security settings cannot be changed by users.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft’s Attack Surface Reduction rules are implemented.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Email client security settings cannot be changed by users.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Security product security settings cannot be changed by users.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office macros are disabled for users that do not have a demonstrated business requirement.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office macros in files originating from the internet are blocked.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office macro antivirus scanning is enabled.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office macros are blocked from making Win32 API calls.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Only Microsoft Office macros running from within a sandboxed environment, a Trusted Location or that are digitally signed by a trusted publisher are allowed to execute.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Only privileged users responsible for validating that Microsoft Office macros are free of malicious code can write to and modify content within Trusted Locations.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office macros digitally signed by an untrusted publisher cannot be enabled via the Message Bar or Backstage View.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office’s list of trusted publishers is validated on an annual or more frequent basis.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office macro security settings cannot be changed by users.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Allowed and blocked Microsoft Office macro execution events are logged.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft Office macro event logs are stored centrally.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Server applications are chosen from vendors that have demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The latest release of internet-facing server applications are used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that ACSC or vendor hardening guidance for server applications is implemented.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Default accounts or credentials for server applications, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unneeded accounts, components, services and functionality of server applications are disabled or removed.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that All temporary installation files and logs created during server application installation processes are removed after server applications have been installed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Server applications are configured to run as a separate account with the minimum privileges needed to perform their functions.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The accounts under which server applications run have limited access to their underlying server’s file system.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft AD DS domain controllers are administered using dedicated domain administrator user accounts that are not used to administer other systems.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The Print Spooler service is disabled on Microsoft AD DS domain controllers.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Passwords and cpasswords are not used in Group Policy Preferences.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that security-related events for Microsoft AD DS are logged.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Microsoft AD DS event logs are stored centrally.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Only service accounts and computer accounts are configured with Service Principal Names (SPNs).?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Service accounts are provisioned with the minimum privileges required and are not members of the domain administrators group or similar highly privileged groups.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Duplicate SPNs do not exist within the domain.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Privileged user accounts are configured as sensitive and cannot be delegated.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that User accounts require Kerberos pre-authentication.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that User accounts are not configured with password never expires or password not required.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The UserPassword attribute for user accounts is not used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Account properties accessible by unprivileged users are not used to store passwords.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that User account passwords do not use reversible encryption.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unprivileged user accounts cannot add machines to the domain.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Dedicated service accounts are used to add machines to the domain.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that User accounts with unconstrained delegation are reviewed at least annually, and those without an associated Kerberos SPN or demonstrated business requirement are removed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Computer accounts that are not Microsoft AD SD domain controllers are not trusted for delegation to services.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Privileged user accounts are members of the Protected Users security group.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When a user account is disabled, it is removed from all security group memberships.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The Pre-Windows 2000 Compatible Access security group does not contain user accounts.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Users are authenticated before they are granted access to a system and its resources.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Authentication methods susceptible to replay attacks are disabled.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that LAN Manager and NT LAN Manager authentication methods are disabled.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate unprivileged users of systems.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate privileged users of systems.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication is used by an organisation’s users if they authenticate to their organisation’s internet-facing services.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication is used by an organisation’s users if they authenticate to third-party internet-facing services that process, store or communicate their organisation's sensitive data.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication (where available) is used by an organisation’s users if they authenticate to third-party internet-facing services that process, store or communicate their organisation's non-sensitive data.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication is enabled by default for non-organisational users (but users can choose to opt out) if they authenticate to an organisation’s internet-facing services.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users accessing important data repositories.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication uses either: something users have and something users know, or something users have that is unlocked by something users know or are.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication is phishing-resistant.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Memorised secrets used for multi-factor authentication are a minimum of 6 characters, unless more stringent requirements apply.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Successful and unsuccessful multi-factor authentication events are logged.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Multi-factor authentication event logs are stored centrally.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When systems cannot support multi-factor authentication, single-factor authentication using passphrases is implemented instead.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Passphrases used for single-factor authentication are at least 4 random words with a total minimum length of 14 characters, unless more stringent requirements apply.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Passphrases used for single-factor authentication are not a list of categorised words; do not form a real sentence in a natural language; and are not constructed from song lyrics, movies, literature or any other publicly available material.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Users provide sufficient evidence to verify their identity when requesting new credentials.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials set for user accounts are randomly generated.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials are provided to users via a secure communications channel or, if not possible, split into two parts with one part provided to users and the other part provided to supervisors.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials provided to users are changed on first use.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials, in the form of memorised secrets, are not reused by users across different systems.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials for local administrator accounts and service accounts are long, unique, unpredictable and managed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Service accounts are created as group Managed Service Accounts.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials for local administrator accounts and service accounts are a minimum of 30 characters.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials are changed if:
• they are directly compromised
• they are suspected of being compromised
• they appear in an online data breach database
• they are discovered stored on networks in the clear
• they are discovered being transferred across networks in the clear
• membership of a shared account changes
• they have not been changed in the past 12 months.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials for the Kerberos Key Distribution Center’s service account (KRBTGT) are changed twice, allowing for replication to all Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services domain controllers in-between each change, if:
• the domain has been directly compromised
• the domain is suspected of being compromised
• they have not been changed in the past 12 months.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials are kept separate from systems they are used to authenticate to, except for when performing authentication activities.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials are obscured as they are entered into systems.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Credentials stored on systems are protected by a password manager; a hardware security module; or by salting, hashing and stretching them before storage within a database.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Windows Defender Credential Guard and Windows Defender Remote Credential Guard are enabled.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Cached credentials are limited to one previous logon.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Accounts are locked out after a maximum of five failed logon attempts.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that On a daily basis, outside of business hours and after an appropriate period of inactivity, user sessions are terminated and workstations are restarted.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Systems are configured with a session or screen lock that:
• activates after a maximum of 15 minutes of user inactivity, or if manually activated by users

• ensures that the screen does not enter a power saving state before the session or screen lock is activated
• requires users to authenticate to unlock the session

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Systems have a logon banner that requires users to acknowledge and accept their security responsibilities before access is granted.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Legal advice is sought on the exact wording of logon banners.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the isolation mechanism is from a vendor that has demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the configuration of the isolation mechanism is hardened by removing unneeded functionality and restricting access to the administrative interface used to manage the isolation mechanism.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the underlying operating system is hardened.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities are applied to the isolation mechanism and underlying operating system in a timely manner.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the isolation mechanism or underlying operating system is replaced when it is no longer supported by a vendor.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, integrity and log monitoring are performed for the isolation mechanism and underlying operating system in a timely manner.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that System administration processes, and supporting system administration procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that System administrators document requirements for administrative activities, consider potential security impacts, obtain any necessary approvals, notify users of any disruptions or outages, and maintain system and security documentation.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Privileged users use separate privileged and unprivileged operating environments.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Privileged operating environments are not virtualised within unprivileged operating environments.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unprivileged accounts cannot logon to privileged operating environments.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Privileged accounts (excluding local administrator accounts) cannot logon to unprivileged operating environments.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Administrative infrastructure is segregated from the wider network.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Administrative infrastructure for critical servers, high-value servers and regular servers is segregated from each other.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network management traffic can only originate from administrative infrastructure.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Administrative activities are conducted through jump servers.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Only privileged operating environments can communicate with jump servers.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Only jump servers can communicate with assets requiring administrative activities to be performed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patch management processes, and supporting patch management procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A centralised and managed approach that maintains the integrity of patches or updates, and confirms that they have been applied successfully, is used to patch or update applications, operating systems, drivers and firmware.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Software registers for workstations, servers, network devices and other ICT equipment are developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Software registers contain versions and patch histories of applications, drivers, operating systems and firmware.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that An automated method of asset discovery is used at least fortnightly to support the detection of assets for subsequent vulnerability scanning activities.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability scanner with an up-to-date vulnerability database is used for vulnerability scanning activities.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability scanner is used at least daily to identify missing patches or updates for security vulnerabilities in internet-facing services.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability scanner is used at least weekly to identify missing patches or updates for security vulnerabilities in office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability scanner is used at least fortnightly to identify missing patches or updates for security vulnerabilities in other applications.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability scanner is used at least daily to identify missing patches or updates for security vulnerabilities in operating systems of internet-facing services.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability scanner is used at least weekly to identify missing patches or updates for security vulnerabilities in operating systems of workstations, servers and network devices.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability scanner is used at least weekly to identify missing patches or updates for security vulnerabilities in operating systems of other ICT equipment.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability scanner is used at least weekly to identify missing patches or updates for security vulnerabilities in drivers and firmware.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in internet-facing services are applied within two weeks of release, or within 48 hours if an exploit exists.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are applied within two weeks of release.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are applied within 48 hours if an exploit exists.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in other applications are applied within one month of release.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in operating systems of internet-facing services are applied within two weeks of release, or within 48 hours if an exploit exists.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in operating systems of workstations, servers and network devices are applied within two weeks of release.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in operating systems of workstations, servers and network devices are applied within 48 hours if an exploit exists.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in operating systems of other ICT equipment are applied within two weeks of release, or within 48 hours if an exploit exists.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in drivers and firmware are applied within two weeks of release, or within 48 hours if an exploit exists.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Internet-facing services, office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, Adobe Flash Player, and security products that are no longer supported by vendors are removed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Applications that are no longer supported by vendors are removed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Operating systems that are no longer supported by vendors are replaced.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network devices and other ICT equipment that are no longer supported by vendors are replaced.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When applications, operating systems, network devices or other ICT equipment that are no longer supported by vendors cannot be immediately removed or replaced, compensating controls are implemented until such time that they can be removed or replaced.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A digital preservation policy is developed, implemented and maintained.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Data backup processes, and supporting data backup procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Data restoration processes, and supporting data restoration procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Backups of important data, software and configuration settings are performed and retained with a frequency and retention timeframe in accordance with business continuity requirements.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Backups of important data, software and configuration settings are synchronised to enable restoration to a common point in time.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Backups of important data, software and configuration settings are retained in a secure and resilient manner.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unprivileged accounts cannot access backups belonging to other accounts.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unprivileged accounts cannot access their own backups.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Privileged accounts (excluding backup administrator accounts) cannot access backups belonging to other accounts.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Privileged accounts (excluding backup administrator accounts) cannot access their own backups.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unprivileged accounts are prevented from modifying and deleting backups.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Privileged accounts (excluding backup administrator accounts) are prevented from modifying and deleting backups.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Privileged accounts (including backup administrator accounts) are prevented from modifying and deleting backups during their retention period.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Restoration of important data, software and configuration settings from backups to a common point of time is tested as part of disaster recovery exercises.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that An event logging policy is developed, implemented and maintained.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that For each event logged, the date and time of the event, the relevant user or process, the relevant filename, the event description, and the ICT equipment involved are recorded.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A centralised event logging facility is implemented and event logs are sent to the facility as soon as possible after they occur.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Event logs stored within a centralised event logging facility are protected from unauthorised modification and deletion.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that An accurate time source is established and used consistently across systems to assist with identifying connections between events.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Event logs are analysed in a timely manner to detect cyber security events.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Cyber security events are analysed in a timely manner to identify cyber security incidents.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Event logs, excluding those for Domain Name System services and web proxies, are retained for at least seven years.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Event logs for Domain Name System services and web proxies are retained for at least 18 months.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Development, testing and production environments are segregated.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Development and modification of software only takes place in development environments.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Data from production environments is not used in a development or testing environment unless the environment is secured to the same level as the production environment.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unauthorised access to the authoritative source for software is prevented.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unauthorised modification of the authoritative source for software is prevented.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, and secure programming practices are used as part of application development.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SecDevOps practices are used for application development.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Threat modelling is used in support of application development.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files containing executable content are digitally signed as part of application development.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Installers, patches and updates are digitally signed or provided with cryptographic checksums as part of application development.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Secure configuration guidance is produced as part of application development.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A software bill of materials is produced and made available to consumers of software.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Applications are comprehensively tested for security vulnerabilities, using both static application security testing and dynamic application security testing, prior to their initial release and following any maintenance activities.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Security vulnerabilities identified in applications are resolved by software developers.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability disclosure program is implemented to assist with the secure development and maintenance of products and services.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A vulnerability disclosure policy is developed, implemented and maintained.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Vulnerability disclosure processes, and supporting vulnerability disclosure procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A ‘security.txt’ file is hosted for all internet-facing organisational domains to assist in the responsible disclosure of security vulnerabilities in an organisation’s products and services.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The OWASP Application Security Verification Standard is used in the development of web applications.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The OWASP Top Ten Proactive Controls are used in the development of web applications.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The OWASP Top 10 are mitigated in the development of web applications.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Robust web application frameworks are used in the development of web applications.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that All web application content is offered exclusively using HTTPS.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Authentication and authorisation of clients is performed when clients call web APIs that facilitate access to data not authorised for release into the public domain.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Authentication and authorisation of clients is performed when clients call web APIs that facilitate modification of data.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The OWASP API Security Top 10 are mitigated in the development of web APIs.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Validation or sanitisation is performed on all input handled by web applications.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Output encoding is performed on all output produced by web applications.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Web applications implement Content-Security-Policy, HSTS and X-Frame-Options via security policy in response headers.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The following events are logged for web applications: attempted access that is denied, crashes and error messages, and search queries initiated by users.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Web application event logs are stored centrally.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Database servers and web servers are functionally separated.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Data communicated between database servers and web servers is encrypted.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Database servers are placed on a different network segment to user workstations.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network access controls are implemented to restrict database server communications to strictly defined network resources, such as web servers, application servers and storage area networks.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that If only local access to a database is required, networking functionality of database management system software is disabled or directed to listen solely to the localhost interface.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Development and testing environments do not use the same database servers as production environments.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A database register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that File-based access controls are applied to database files.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Databases and their contents are classified based on the sensitivity or classification of data that they contain.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Database users’ ability to access, insert, modify and remove database contents is restricted based on their work duties.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The need-to-know principle is enforced for database contents through the application of minimum privileges, database views and database roles.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Database contents from production environments are not used in development or testing environments unless the environment is secured to the same level as the production environment.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that All queries to databases from web applications are filtered for legitimate content and correct syntax.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Parameterised queries or stored procedures, instead of dynamically generated queries, are used for database interactions.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Web applications are designed or configured to provide as little error information as possible about the structure of databases.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The following events are logged for databases:
• access or modification of particularly important content
• addition of new users, especially privileged users
• changes to user roles or privileges
• attempts to elevate user privileges
• queries containing comments
• queries containing multiple embedded queries
• database and query alerts or failures
• database structure changes
• database administrator actions
• use of executable commands
• database logons and logoffs.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Database event logs are stored centrally.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that An email usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Access to non-approved webmail services is blocked.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Protective markings are applied to emails and reflect the highest sensitivity or classification of the subject, body and attachments.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Protective marking tools do not automatically insert protective markings into emails.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Protective marking tools do not allow users to select protective markings that a system has not been authorised to process, store or communicate.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Protective marking tools do not allow users replying to or forwarding emails to select protective markings lower than previously used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Email servers are configured to block, log and report emails with inappropriate protective markings.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The intended recipients of blocked inbound emails, and the senders of blocked outbound emails, are notified.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Emails are routed via centralised email gateways.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When users send or receive emails, an authenticated and encrypted channel is used to route emails via their organisation’s centralised email gateways.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Where backup or alternative email gateways are in place, they are maintained at the same standard as the primary email gateway.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Email servers only relay emails destined for or originating from their domains (including subdomains).?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Opportunistic TLS encryption is enabled on email servers that make incoming or outgoing email connections over public network infrastructure.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that MTA-STS is enabled to prevent the unencrypted transfer of emails between complying servers.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SPF is used to specify authorised email servers (or lack thereof) for all domains (including subdomains).?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A hard fail SPF record is used when specifying authorised email servers (or lack thereof) for all domains (including subdomains).?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SPF is used to verify the authenticity of incoming emails.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that DKIM signing is enabled on emails originating from an organisation’s domains (including subdomains).?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that DKIM signatures on received emails are verified.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Email distribution list software used by external senders is configured such that it does not break the validity of the sender’s DKIM signature.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that DMARC records are configured for all domains (including subdomains) such that emails are rejected if they do not pass DMARC checks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Incoming emails are rejected if they do not pass DMARC checks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Email content filtering is implemented to filter potentially harmful content in email bodies and attachments.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Emails arriving via an external connection where the email source address uses an internal domain, or internal subdomain, are blocked at the email gateway.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Notifications of undeliverable emails are only sent to senders that can be verified via SPF or other trusted means.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network documentation is developed, implemented, maintained.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network documentation includes high-level network diagrams showing all connections into networks and logical network diagrams showing all critical servers, high-value servers, network devices and network security appliances.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network documentation provided to a third party, or published in public tender documentation, only contains details necessary for other parties to undertake contractual services.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that All data communicated over network infrastructure is encrypted.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Networks are segregated into multiple network zones according to the criticality of servers, services and data.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that An organisation’s networks are segregated from their service providers’ networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that VLANs are not used to separate network traffic between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that VLANs are not used to separate network traffic between networks belonging to different security domains.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network devices managing VLANs are administered from the most trusted security domain.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network devices managing VLANs belonging to different security domains do not share VLAN trunks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network devices managing VLANs terminate VLANs belonging to different security domains on separate physical network interfaces.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that IPv6 functionality is disabled in dual-stack network devices unless it is being used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that IPv6 capable network security appliances are used on IPv6 and dual-stack networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unless explicitly required, IPv6 tunnelling is disabled on all network devices.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that IPv6 tunnelling is blocked by network security appliances at externally-connected network boundaries.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Dynamically assigned IPv6 addresses are configured with Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol version 6 in a stateful manner with lease data stored in a centralised event logging facility.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network access controls are implemented on networks to prevent the connection of unauthorised network devices.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network access controls are implemented to limit network traffic within and between network segments to only those required for business purposes.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Servers maintain effective functional separation with other servers allowing them to operate independently.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Servers minimise communications with other servers at both the network and file system level.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Security measures are implemented to prevent unauthorised access to network management traffic.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SNMP version 1 and SNMP version 2 are not used on networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that All default SNMP community strings on network devices are changed and write access is disabled.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A NIDS or NIPS is deployed in gateways between an organisation’s networks and other networks they do not manage.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A NIDS or NIPS is located immediately inside the outermost firewall for gateways and configured to generate event logs and alerts for network traffic that contravenes any rule in a firewall ruleset.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Inbound network connections from anonymity networks to internet-facing services are blocked.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Outbound network connections to anonymity networks are blocked.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A protective DNS service is used to block access to known malicious domain names.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network devices are flashed with trusted firmware before they are used for the first time.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Default accounts or credentials for network devices including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Unused physical ports on network devices are disabled.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Network devices are restarted on at least a monthly basis.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that All wireless devices are Wi-Fi Alliance certified.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Public wireless networks provided for general public use are segregated from all other organisation networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The administrative interface on wireless access points is disabled for wireless network connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Configuration settings for wireless access points are hardened.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Default SSIDs of wireless access points are changed.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SSIDs of non-public wireless networks are not readily associated with an organisation, the location of their premises or the functionality of wireless networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SSID broadcasting is not disabled on wireless access points.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that MAC address filtering is not used to restrict which devices can connect to wireless networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Static addressing is not used for assigning IP addresses on wireless networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that WPA3-Enterprise 192-bit mode is used to protect the confidentiality and integrity of all wireless network traffic.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that 802.1X authentication with EAP-TLS, using X.509 certificates, is used for mutual authentication; with all other EAP methods disabled on supplications and authentication servers.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that User identity confidentiality is used if available with EAP-TLS implementations.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Evaluated supplicants, authenticators, wireless access points and authentication servers are used in wireless networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Certificates are generated using an evaluated certificate authority or hardware security module.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Certificates are required for both devices and users accessing wireless networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Certificates are protected by encryption, user authentication, and both logical and physical access controls.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The PMK caching period is not set to greater than 1440 minutes (24 hours).?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The use of FT (802.11r) is disabled unless authenticator-to-authenticator communications are secured by an ASD-Approved Cryptographic Protocol.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Communications between authenticators and a RADIUS server are encapsulated with an additional layer of encryption using RADIUS over Internet Protocol Security or RADIUS over Transport Layer Security.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Wireless networks implement sufficient frequency separation from other wireless networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Wireless access points enable the use of the 802.11w amendment to protect management frames.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Instead of deploying a small number of wireless access points that broadcast on high power, a greater number of wireless access points that use less broadcast power are deployed to achieve the desired footprint for wireless networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Cloud service providers are used for hosting online services.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that An organisation is notified by cloud service providers of any change to configured regions or availability zones for online services.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Cloud service providers’ ability to dynamically scale resources due to a genuine spike in demand or a denial-of-service attack is tested as part of capacity planning processes for online services.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Where a high availability requirement exists for online services, the services are architected to automatically transition between availability zones.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Where a requirement for high availability exists for online services, a denial of service mitigation service is used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Continuous real-time monitoring of the availability of online services is performed.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Where a high availability requirement exists for website hosting, CDNs that cache websites are used.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that If using CDNs, disclosing the IP addresses of web servers under an organisation’s control (referred to as origin servers) is avoided and access to the origin servers is restricted to the CDNs and authorised management networks.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Denial-of-service attack mitigation strategies are discussed with cloud service providers, specifically:
• their capacity to withstand denial-of-service attacks
• any costs likely to be incurred as a result of denial-of-service attacks
• thresholds for notification of denial-of-service attacks
• thresholds for turning off online services during denial-of-service attacks
• pre-approved actions that can be undertaken during denial-of-service attacks
• any arrangements with upstream service providers to block malicious network traffic as far upstream as possible.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The functionality and quality of online services, how to maintain such functionality, and what functionality can be lived without during a denial-of-service attack, are determined and documented.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Domain names for online services are protected via registrar locking and confirming domain registration details are correct.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Availability monitoring with real-time alerting is implemented for online services to detect denial-of-service attacks and measure their impact.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Critical online services are segregated from other online services that are more likely to be targeted.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A static version of a website is pre-prepared that requires minimal processing and bandwidth in order to facilitate at least a basic level of service when under a denial-of-service attack.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Cryptographic key management processes, and supporting cryptographic key management procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that An ASD-Approved Cryptographic Algorithm (AACA) or high assurance cryptographic algorithm is used when encrypting media.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Cryptographic equipment or software that has completed a Common Criteria evaluation against a Protection Profile is used when encrypting media that contains OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED data.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Full disk encryption, or partial encryption where access controls will only allow writing to the encrypted partition, is implemented when encrypting data at rest.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that An ASD-Approved Cryptographic Protocol (AACP) or high assurance cryptographic protocol is used to protect data when communicated over network infrastructure.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Cryptographic equipment or software that has completed a Common Criteria evaluation against a Protection Profile is used to protect OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED data when communicated over insufficiently secure networks, outside of appropriately secure areas or via public network infrastructure.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Where practical, cryptographic equipment and software provides a means of data recovery to allow for circumstances where the encryption key is unavailable due to loss, damage or failure.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When a user authenticates to the encryption functionality of ICT equipment or media, it is treated in accordance with its original sensitivity or classification until the user deauthenticates from the encryption functionality.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Keyed cryptographic equipment is transported based on the sensitivity or classification of its keying material.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The compromise or suspected compromise of cryptographic equipment or associated keying material is reported to an organisation’s Chief Information Security Officer, or one of their delegates, as soon as possible after it occurs.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Keying material is changed when compromised or suspected of being compromised.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Only AACAs or high assurance cryptographic algorithms are used by cryptographic equipment and software.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that ECDH and ECDSA are used in preference to DH and DSA.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using DH for agreeing on encryption session keys, a modulus of at least 2048 bits is used, preferably 3072 bits.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using DH for agreeing on encryption session keys, a modulus and associated parameters are selected according to NIST SP 800-56A Rev. 3.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using DSA for digital signatures, a modulus of at least 2048 bits is used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using DSA for digital signatures, a modulus and associated parameters are generated according to FIPS 186-4.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using elliptic curve cryptography, a curve from FIPS 186-4 is used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using ECDH for agreeing on encryption session keys, a base point order and key size of at least 224 bits is used, preferably the NIST P-384 curve.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using ECDSA for digital signatures, a base point order and key size of at least 224 bits is used, preferably the P-384 curve.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using RSA for digital signatures, and passing encryption session keys or similar keys, a modulus of at least 2048 bits is used, preferably 3072 bits.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using RSA for digital signatures, and for passing encryption session keys or similar keys, a different key pair is used for digital signatures and passing encrypted session keys.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using SHA-2 for hashing, an output size of at least 224 bits is used, preferably SHA-384.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using AES for encryption, AES-128, AES-192 or AES-256 is used, preferably AES-256.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Symmetric cryptographic algorithms are not used in Electronic Codebook Mode.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Only AACPs or high assurance cryptographic protocols are used by cryptographic equipment and software.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Only the latest version of TLS is used for TLS connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that AES-GCM is used for encryption of TLS connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Only server-initiated secure renegotiation is used for TLS connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that DH or ECDH is used for key establishment of TLS connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using DH or ECDH for key establishment of TLS connections, the ephemeral variant is used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Anonymous DH is not used for TLS connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SHA-2-based certificates are used for TLS connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SHA-2 is used for the Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) and pseudorandom function (PRF) for TLS connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that TLS compression is disabled for TLS connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS) is used for TLS connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The use of SSH version 1 is disabled for SSH connections.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The SSH daemon is configured to:
• only listen on the required interfaces (ListenAddress xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx)
• have a suitable login banner (Banner x)
• have a login authentication timeout of no more than 60 seconds (LoginGraceTime 60)
• disable host-based authentication (HostbasedAuthentication no)
• disable rhosts-based authentication (IgnoreRhosts yes)
• disable the ability to login directly as root (PermitRootLogin no)
• disable empty passwords (PermitEmptyPasswords no)
• disable connection forwarding (AllowTCPForwarding no)
• disable gateway ports (GatewayPorts no)
• disable X11 forwarding (X11Forwarding no).?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Public key-based authentication is used for SSH connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that SSH private keys are protected with a passphrase or a key encryption key.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When using logins without a passphrase for SSH connections, the following are disabled:
• access from IP addresses that do not require access
• port forwarding
• agent credential forwarding
• X11 display remoting
• console access.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that If using remote access without the use of a passphrase for SSH connections, the ‘forced command’ option is used to specify what command is executed and parameter checking is enabled.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When SSH-agent or similar key caching programs are used, it is limited to workstations and servers with screen locks and key caches that are set to expire within four hours of inactivity.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Versions of S/MIME earlier than S/MIME version 3.0 are not used for S/MIME connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Tunnel mode is used for IPsec connections; however, if using transport mode, an IP tunnel is used.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The ESP protocol is used for authentication and encryption of IPsec connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that IKE version 2 is used for key exchange when establishing IPsec connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that AES is used for encrypting IPsec connections, preferably ENCR_AES_GCM_16.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that PRF_HMAC_SHA2_256, PRF_HMAC_SHA2_384 or PRF_HMAC_SHA2_512 is used for IPsec connections, preferably PRF_HMAC_SHA2_512.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that AUTH_HMAC_SHA2_256_128, AUTH_HMAC_SHA2_384_192, AUTH_HMAC_SHA2_512_256 or NONE (only with AES-GCM) is used for authenticating IPsec connections, preferably NONE.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that DH or ECDH is used for key establishment of IPsec connections, preferably 384-bit random ECP group, 3072-bit MODP Group or 4096-bit MODP Group.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A security association lifetime of less than four hours (14400 seconds) is used for IPsec connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that PFS is used for IPsec connections.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Gateways are implemented between networks belonging to different security domains.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Gateways implement a demilitarised zone if external parties require access to an organisation’s services.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Gateways only allow explicitly authorised data flows.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Gateways inspect and filter data flows at the transport and above network layers.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Gateways perform ingress traffic filtering to detect and prevent IP source address spoofing.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that System administrators for gateways undergo appropriate employment screening and, where necessary, hold an appropriate security clearance based on the sensitivity or classification of gateways.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that System administrators for gateways are assigned the minimum privileges required to perform their duties.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Separation of duties is implemented in performing administrative activities for gateways.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that System administrators for gateways are formally trained on the operation and management of gateways.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Gateways are managed via a secure path isolated from all connected networks.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that For gateways between networks belonging to different security domains, any shared components are managed by system administrators for the higher security domain or by system administrators from a mutually-agreed third party.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Users authenticate to other networks accessed via gateways.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that ICT equipment authenticates to other networks accessed via gateways.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Public IP addresses controlled by, or used by, an organisation are signed by valid ROA records.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The following events are logged for gateways:
• data packets and data flows permitted through gateways
• data packets and data flows attempting to leave gateways
• real-time alerts for attempted intrusions.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Gateway event logs are stored centrally.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Gateways undergo testing following configuration changes, and at regular intervals no more than six months apart, to validate they conform to expected security configurations.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Gateways undergo a security assessment by an IRAP assessor at least every 24 months.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Evaluated firewalls are used between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Evaluated firewalls are used between networks belonging to different security domains.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Evaluated diodes are used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Evaluated diodes are used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between networks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that A web usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that All web access, including that by internal servers, is conducted through web proxies.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that The following details are logged for websites accessed via web proxies:
• address
• date and time
• user
• amount of data uploaded and downloaded
• internal and external IP addresses.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Web proxy event logs are stored centrally.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Web content filtering is implemented to filter potentially harmful web-based content.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Client-side active content is restricted by web content filters to an organisation-approved list of domain names.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Web content filtering is applied to outbound web traffic where appropriate.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that TLS traffic communicated through gateways is decrypted and inspected.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that An organisation-approved list of domain names, or list of website categories, is implemented for all Hypertext Transfer Protocol and Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure traffic communicated through gateways.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Malicious domain names, dynamic domain names and domain names that can be registered anonymously for free are blocked by web content filters.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Attempts to access websites through their IP addresses instead of their domain names are blocked by web content filters.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content filtering checks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files identified by content filtering checks as malicious, or that cannot be inspected, are blocked.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files identified by content filtering checks as suspicious are quarantined until reviewed and subsequently approved or not approved for release.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Encrypted files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are decrypted in order to undergo content filtering checks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Archive files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are unpacked in order to undergo content filtering checks.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Archive files are unpacked in a controlled manner to ensure content filter performance or availability is not adversely affected.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo antivirus scanning using multiple different scanning engines.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Executable files imported via gateways or CDSs are automatically executed in a sandbox to detect any suspicious behaviour.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are filtered for allowed file types.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content validation.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content conversion.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content sanitisation.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs that have a digital signature or cryptographic checksum are validated.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Evaluated peripheral switches are used when sharing peripherals between systems.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Data transfer processes, and supporting data transfer procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Users transferring data to and from systems are held accountable for data transfers they perform.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When manually importing data to systems, the data is scanned for malicious and active content.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When manually importing data to systems, all data that fails security checks is quarantined until reviewed and subsequently approved or not approved for release.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When manually exporting data from systems, the data is checked for unsuitable protective markings.?

In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that When manually exporting data from systems, all data that fails security checks is quarantined until reviewed and subsequently approved or not approved for release.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Data transfer logs are used to record all data imports and exports from systems.?
In the ACSC ISM, which controls describe that Data transfer logs for systems are partially verified at least monthly.?
In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which system owners can protect systems and their resources?
output: System owners can ensure they have adequate protection by implementing appropriate controls such as access control, data encryption, auditing etc ISM-0027. System owners obtain authorisation to operate each system from its authorising officer based on the acceptance of the security risks associated with its operation.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some key components of a cybersecurity strategy?
output: The main component of any cybersecurity strategy is having strong policies and procedures for data protection. ISM-0039. A cyber security strategy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of systems with a system security plan?
output: Examples include computer networks, software applications, websites, databases, etc ISM-0041. Systems have a system security plan that includes a description of the system and an annex that covers both applicable controls from this document and any additional controls that have been identified.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of system specific security documents?
output: Examples include: ISM-0041. Systems have a system security plan that includes a description of the system and an annex that covers both applicable controls from this document and any additional controls that have been identified.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What should an organization do to develop, implement and maintain system administration processes and procedures?
output: An organization should ensure that all system administration processes and procedures are documented in detail and followed by all employees involved with system administration tasks. ISM-0042. System administration processes, and supporting system administration procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of system administration processes?
output: Examples include configuration management, change control, backup/recovery, security monitoring, etc - ISM-0042. System administration processes, and supporting system administration procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of system administration processes?
output: Examples include configuration management, change control, backup/recovery, security monitoring, incident handling, etc - ISM-0042. System administration processes, and supporting system administration procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of system administration processes?
output: Examples include configuring servers, managing user accounts, maintaining security policies, monitoring performance, etc - ISM-0042. System administration processes, and supporting system administration procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are the responsibilities of the CISO and SAO?
output: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) approves organisational-level security documents, such as policies or standards, whereas the System Authorizing Officer (SAO) approves system-specific security documents, such as procedures or guidelines ISM-0047. Organisational-level security documentation is approved by the Chief Information Security Officer while system-specific security documentation is approved by the system’s authorising officer.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of organisational level security documents?
output: Examples include: ISM-0047. Organisational-level security documentation is approved by the Chief Information Security Officer while system-specific security documentation is approved by the system’s authorising officer.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What security measures should be taken when outsourcing?
