instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some guidelines for developing a cybersecurity document?
output: Guidelines for developing a cybersecurity document include: 1) Identify the scope of the project; 2) Define the audience; 3) Determine the purpose of the document; 4) Establish the structure of the document; 5) Create a draft outline; 6) Review the content; 7) Finalize the document ISM-1478. The CISO oversees their organisation’s cyber security program and ensures their organisation’s compliance with cyber security policy, standards, regulations and legislation.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does it mean for a server to minimize communication?
output: It means reducing or limiting the amount of data sent between two systems, such as computers or networks ISM-1479. Servers minimise communications with other servers at both the network and file system level.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which functional separation can help reduce server vulnerabilities?
output: Functional separation helps reduce server vulnerability by limiting access to critical resources such as data storage or processing power. ISM-1479. Servers minimise communications with other servers at both the network and file system level.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of organisational policies related to Mobile Device Management (MDM)?
output: Some examples of organizational policies related to MDM include: ISM-1482. Personnel accessing systems or data using an organisation-owned mobile device use an ASD-approved platform, a security configuration in accordance with ACSC guidance, and have enforced separation of work and personal data.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which you can prevent your browser from processing web ads?
output: You can disable cookies or use an extension like Adblock Plus ISM-1485. Web browsers do not process web advertisements from the internet.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does web browser mean?
output: An application used for browsing and viewing content on the World Wide Web - ISM-1485. Web browsers do not process web advertisements from the internet.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can I block ads on my browser?
output: You can use extensions or add-ons for your browser, such as Adblock Plus and uBlock Origin - ISM-1485. Web browsers do not process web advertisements from the internet.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which web browser can prevent java from being processed by the Internet?
output: Web browsers can block all active content such as JavaScript or Java applets from running on websites unless they have been explicitly allowed by the user. ISM-1486. Web browsers do not process Java from the internet.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM Why does my web browser block java?
output: Your web browser blocks java because it may contain malicious code or viruses - ISM-1486. Web browsers do not process Java from the internet.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What steps can you take to secure your computer against malicious software attacks?
output: You can use antivirus programs, install patches regularly, keep all applications up to date, avoid clicking on suspicious links or attachments, and always back up important data ISM-1488. Microsoft Office macros in files originating from the internet are blocked.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How do I enable macros in documents downloaded from the Internet?
output: You can allow macros by changing your security settings on your computer or device. ISM-1488. Microsoft Office macros in files originating from the internet are blocked.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How do I enable macros in documents downloaded from the Internet?
output: You can allow macros by changing your security settings and enabling them for specific websites or domains. ISM-1488. Microsoft Office macros in files originating from the internet are blocked.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can I change my Microsoft Office macro security settings?
output: You cannot change your Microsoft Office macro security settings as they are controlled by administrators and cannot be modified by end-users ISM-1489. Microsoft Office macro security settings cannot be changed by users.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can user applications be hardened against malicious code execution attacks?
output: User applications can be hardened against malicious code execution attacks through various methods such as whitelisting, sandboxing, and virtualization ISM-1489. Microsoft Office macro security settings cannot be changed by users.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you implement application control in your network?
output: Implementing application control involves configuring access controls at different levels such as user level, group level or role based level. ISM-1490. Application control is implemented on internet-facing servers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does Operating System Exploit Protection mean?
output: It means that your operating system has been configured with additional security features designed to prevent malicious software from gaining access and taking control of your computer - ISM-1492. Operating system exploit protection functionality is enabled.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does Operating System Exploit Protection mean?
output: It means that your operating system has been configured with additional security measures to prevent malicious attacks and viruses from infecting it - ISM-1492. Operating system exploit protection functionality is enabled.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which you can protect your computer from malware attacks?
output: There are many different methods available to help prevent malicious software (malware) from infecting your device. Some common steps include keeping all applications up to date with the latest patches, using antivirus programs, avoiding suspicious websites or emails, and not clicking on links sent by unknown sources ISM-1492. Operating system exploit protection functionality is enabled.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does registers mean?
output: Registers refer to lists of data used by computers or software programs - ISM-1493. Software registers for workstations, servers, network devices and other ICT equipment are developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What should an organization do to develop software registers for workstations, servers, network devices and other ICT equipment?
output: An organization should implement, maintain and verify software registers for workstations, servers, network devices and other ICT equipment on a regular basis ISM-1493. Software registers for workstations, servers, network devices and other ICT equipment are developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What should an organization do when operating system is no longer supported by vendor?
output: An organization should replace unsupported OS with new version or migrate to another platform ISM-1501. Operating systems that are no longer supported by vendors are replaced.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is multi-factor authentication?
output: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is a security process whereby a user provides two or more pieces of evidence to verify his/her identity before being granted access to a service, application or network. ISM-1504. Multi-factor authentication is used by an organisation’s users if they authenticate to their organisation’s internet-facing services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is multi-factor authentication?
output: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is a security process whereby a user provides two or more pieces of evidence to verify his/her identity before being granted access to a service, application or network resource. ISM-1504. Multi-factor authentication is used by an organisation’s users if they authenticate to their organisation’s internet-facing services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of multi-factor authentication?
output: Some examples of multi-factor authentication include using a password with a second factor such as a fingerprint or facial recognition ISM-1504. Multi-factor authentication is used by an organisation’s users if they authenticate to their organisation’s internet-facing services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is multi-factor authentication?
output: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is a security process that requires multiple forms of identification from different categories, such as something you know and something you have or are, before granting access to sensitive systems or resources ISM-1505. Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users accessing important data repositories.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of multi-factor authentication methods?
output: Some examples of multi-factor authentication methods include biometrics (fingerprints), smart cards, tokens, PIN codes, SMS messages, etc ISM-1505. Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users accessing important data repositories.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can I enable SSH version 2 on my system?
output: Enable SSH version 2 by editing /etc/sshd_config file ISM-1506. The use of SSH version 1 is disabled for SSH connections.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens if I ask for privilege access?
output: Your request will be reviewed by security personnel, who may contact you with additional questions or requests for more information before granting your request. ISM-1507. Requests for privileged access to systems and applications are validated when first requested.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of privilege escalation attacks?
output: Some examples of privilege escalation attacks include buffer overflows, race conditions, and denial of service (DoS) attacks ISM-1508. Privileged access to systems and applications is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does privilege mean?
output: Access granted to perform certain actions or tasks, such as accessing data or performing administrative functions - ISM-1508. Privileged access to systems and applications is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What type of event is logged?
output: Privileged access - ISM-1509. Privileged access events are logged.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is privilege escalation attack?
output: Privilege Escalation Attack refers to gaining unauthorized access to system resources by exploiting vulnerabilities in existing software or hardware. ISM-1509. Privileged access events are logged.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some steps involved in developing a digital preservation policy?
output: The first step involves identifying what needs to be preserved and why it should be preserved. Next, you need to identify who will have access to the content and how long they can keep it for. Finally, you must decide on which format(s) your data will be stored as so that it remains accessible over time. ISM-1510. A digital preservation policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some steps involved in developing a digital preservation policy?
output: The first step involves identifying what needs to be preserved and why it should be preserved. Next, you need to identify who will have access to the content and how long they can keep it for. Finally, you must decide on which format(s) the data will be stored in so that it remains accessible over time. ISM-1510. A digital preservation policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some best practices for developing a digital preservation policy?
output: Some best practices for developing a digital preservation policy include identifying key stakeholders, defining scope, conducting research on existing policies, creating a draft document, reviewing with stakeholders, finalizing the policy, implementing it, monitoring its effectiveness, and updating as needed ISM-1510. A digital preservation policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is the control?
output: The control is backups of important data, software and configuration settings - ISM-1511. Backups of important data, software and configuration settings are performed and retained with a frequency and retention timeframe in accordance with business continuity requirements.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What should an organization do to perform and retain backups?
output: An organization should perform regular backups of its critical information and store them securely so they can be restored if needed ISM-1511. Backups of important data, software and configuration settings are performed and retained with a frequency and retention timeframe in accordance with business continuity requirements.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which you can test your data backup and restore process?
output: You can perform regular tests on your backup system by simulating failures or other scenarios such as power outages. You can also use tools like Backup Validator to check if your backups are working properly ISM-1515. Restoration of important data, software and configuration settings from backups to a common point of time is tested as part of disaster recovery exercises.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some media destruction methods?
output: Some media destruction methods include shredding, pulverizing, incineration, degaussing, and erasure ISM-1517. Equipment that is capable of reducing microform to a fine powder, with resultant particles not showing more than five consecutive characters per particle upon microscopic inspection, is used to destroy microfiche and microfilm.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways to prepare for service continuity during a DDoS attack?
output: Some ways to prepare for service continuity during a DDos attack include preparing a static version of your site which can provide limited functionality even if it's being attacked by a large number of users ISM-1518. A static version of a website is pre-prepared that requires minimal processing and bandwidth in order to facilitate at least a basic level of service when under a denial-of-service attack.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of system administrator responsibilities in relation to gateways?
output: System Administrator Responsibility includes maintaining the integrity of the gateway by ensuring it remains operational at all times; monitoring the performance of the gateway and taking action when required; managing user access to the gateway; and implementing changes to the gateway as directed by management ISM-1520. System administrators for gateways undergo appropriate employment screening and, where necessary, hold an appropriate security clearance based on the sensitivity or classification of gateways.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does register mean?
output: Register means to record or list something, such as a name or address - ISM-1525. System owners register each system with its authorising officer.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some responsibilities of a system owner in information systems management?
output: The responsibility of a system owner includes ensuring that all users have access only to data they need to perform their job functions; maintaining accurate records on user accounts and privileges; monitoring usage patterns and reporting any unusual activity or trends; and providing training to new employees regarding proper use of company resources ISM-1525. System owners register each system with its authorising officer.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which system owners can protect systems and their resources from cyber attacks?
output: System owners can protect systems by ensuring they have strong passwords, regularly updating software, using anti-virus programs, backing up data, monitoring logs, and keeping all devices updated with the latest patches ISM-1526. System owners monitor each system, and associated cyber threats, security risks and controls, on an ongoing basis.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is evaluated firewall?
output: An evaluated firewall is a type of firewall that has been tested by independent third parties for its ability to protect against cyber threats - ISM-1528. Evaluated firewalls are used between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does security container mean?
output: Security containers are physical enclosures designed to protect sensitive data from unauthorized access - ISM-1530. Servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in security containers or secure rooms suitable for their sensitivity or classification taking into account the combination of security zones they reside in.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is a virtual local area network (VLAN)?
output: A virtual local area network (VLAN) is a logical subdivision of a computer network which limits communication between devices on one LAN segment to those devices only. ISM-1532. VLANs are not used to separate network traffic between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some steps involved in developing a mobile device management (MDM) policy?
output: The first step involves identifying the goals of your MDM policy. Next you should create a list of requirements for devices using the policy. Then you can develop a plan for implementing the policy across all devices. Finally, it's important to maintain the policy by regularly reviewing its effectiveness and updating as needed ISM-1533. A mobile device management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some steps involved in developing a mobile device management (MDM) policy?
output: The first step involves identifying the goals of your MDM policy. Next you should create a list of requirements for devices and users. Then you can develop a plan for how to implement these policies on all relevant devices. Finally, it's important to maintain this policy by regularly reviewing its effectiveness and updating as needed ISM-1533. A mobile device management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some best practices in developing a mobile device management (MDM) policy?
output: Some best practices in developing a MDM policy include ensuring it aligns with your company's overall IT policies, defining clear roles and responsibilities, and making sure all employees understand how they can help protect corporate data on personal devices ISM-1533. A mobile device management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What should you do with used printer ribbon?
output: You should remove it from your device, then destroy it by crushing or shredding - ISM-1534. Printer ribbons in printers and MFDs are removed and destroyed.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is the purpose of web application event logging?
output: The purpose of web application event logging is to record information about user activity on websites or web apps ISM-1536. The following events are logged for web applications: attempted access that is denied, crashes and error messages, and search queries initiated by users.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of events that can be logged in a database?
output:
Some examples of events that can be logged in a database include: ISM-1537. The following events are logged for databases:
• access or modification of particularly important content
• addition of new users, especially privileged users
• changes to user roles or privileges
• attempts to elevate user privileges
• queries containing comments
• queries containing multiple embedded queries
• database and query alerts or failures
• database structure changes
• database administrator actions
• use of executable commands
• database logons and logoffs.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What types of logs does a database generate?
output:
Databases can log errors, warnings and exceptions as well as performance metrics such as CPU usage or disk I/O - ISM-1537. The following events are logged for databases:
• access or modification of particularly important content
• addition of new users, especially privileged users
• changes to user roles or privileges
• attempts to elevate user privileges
• queries containing comments
• queries containing multiple embedded queries
• database and query alerts or failures
• database structure changes
• database administrator actions
• use of executable commands
• database logons and logoffs.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does it mean when DMARC records are configured?
output: It means that email messages sent from your domain will be checked against certain criteria, and any message failing those tests will be rejected by the recipient's server. ISM-1540. DMARC records are configured for all domains (including subdomains) such that emails are rejected if they do not pass DMARC checks.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does ISM-1540 DMARC records mean?
output: It means that email gateways and servers have been configured with domain-based message authentication, reporting and conformance. ISM-1540. DMARC records are configured for all domains (including subdomains) such that emails are rejected if they do not pass DMARC checks.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of user application hardening techniques?
output: Examples include disabling macros in MS Word documents, blocking ActiveX controls from running on web pages, enabling strong passwords, etc ISM-1542. Microsoft Office is configured to prevent activation of Object Linking and Embedding packages.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is application control?
output: Applications control refers to controlling access to applications on your computer or network. It can also refer to limiting what users can run on their computers ISM-1544. Microsoft’s ‘recommended block rules’ are implemented.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does control mean?
output: Control refers to the ability of users to restrict or limit access to certain systems, data, or other resources. - ISM-1546. Users are authenticated before they are granted access to a system and its resources.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is authentication hardening?
output: Authentication hardening refers to strengthening the process of user identification by adding additional layers of protection such as multi factor authentication or biometric verification ISM-1546. Users are authenticated before they are granted access to a system and its resources.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of data backup procedures?
output: Examples include backing up files on a regular basis, storing backups offsite or at another location, encrypting sensitive data, and using multiple copies for redundancy - ISM-1547. Data backup processes, and supporting data backup procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of data backup procedures?
output: Examples include regular backups, incremental backups, differential backups, full backups, etc - ISM-1547. Data backup processes, and supporting data backup procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is control description?
output: Control Description refers to the process of developing, implementing and maintaining data restoration procedures ISM-1548. Data restoration processes, and supporting data restoration procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of policies related to media use in organizations?
output: Examples include social media guidelines, email etiquette rules, video conferencing protocols ISM-1549. A media management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some steps involved in developing a media management policy?
output: The first step involves identifying the purpose of the policy and defining its scope. Next, you should conduct research on existing policies and best practices for similar organizations. Then, create a draft document outlining your proposed policy. Finally, review it with stakeholders and make any necessary revisions before implementing it. ISM-1549. A media management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some of the steps involved in developing ICT equipment disposal processes?
output: The first step involves identifying all relevant stakeholders who will be affected by the process. Next, you should conduct research on existing best practices for similar organizations. Then, create a plan with clear goals and objectives. Finally, implement your new process and monitor its effectiveness over time ISM-1550. ICT equipment disposal processes, and supporting ICT equipment disposal procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of an ICT equipment management policy?
output: Examples include ensuring all devices have up-to-date antivirus software installed, regular backups of data, and proper disposal of old hardware ISM-1551. An ICT equipment management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of an ICT equipment management policy?
output: Examples include ensuring all devices have up-to-date antivirus software installed, regular backups of data, and maintaining physical security for hardware. ISM-1551. An ICT equipment management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of an ICT equipment management policy?
output: Examples include ensuring all devices have up-to-date antivirus software installed, regularly backing up data on servers or cloud storage, and having policies for handling lost or stolen devices ISM-1551. An ICT equipment management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does HTTPS stand for?
output: Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure - ISM-1552. All web application content is offered exclusively using HTTPS.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some best practices when developing a secure web application?
output: When developing a secure web application, it's important to ensure all data transmitted between client and server is encrypted via SSL/TLS protocols. ISM-1552. All web application content is offered exclusively using HTTPS.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some steps you can take before traveling abroad with your mobile devices?
output:
Before traveling abroad with your mobile devices, it's recommended to record all details of the mobile devices being taken, such as product types, serial numbers and IMEI numbers; update all operating systems and applications; remove all non-essential accounts, applications and data; apply security configuration settings, such as lock screens; configure remote locate and wipe functionality; enable encryption, including for any removable media; back up all important data and configuration settings ISM-1555. Before travelling overseas with mobile devices, personnel take the following actions:
• record all details of the mobile devices being taken, such as product types, serial numbers and International Mobile Equipment Identity numbers
• update all operating systems and applications
• remove all non-essential accounts, applications and data
• apply security configuration settings, such as lock screens
• configure remote locate and wipe functionality
• enable encryption, including for any removable media
• backup all important data and configuration settings.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which you can protect your data on your phone while traveling abroad?
output:
There are several steps one can follow to ensure protection of data on phones when traveling abroad. These include: ISM-1556. If returning from travelling overseas with mobile devices to high or extreme risk countries, personnel take the following additional actions:
• reset credentials used with mobile devices, including those used for remote access to their organisation’s systems
• monitor accounts for any indicators of compromise, such as failed logon attempts.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which video conferencing and internet protocol telephony can be secured?
output: Some ways in which video conferencing and internet protocol telephony can be secured include using encryption, authentication, access control, data loss prevention, intrusion detection systems, firewalls, anti-virus software, and network segmentation ISM-1562. Video conferencing and IP telephony infrastructure is hardened.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does hardening mean?
output: Hardening refers to making something more secure or robust by adding additional security measures - ISM-1562. Video conferencing and IP telephony infrastructure is hardened.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of system specific security documents?
output:
System-specific security documents include security policies, standards, procedures, guidelines, plans, reports etc. ISM-1563. At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a security assessment report is produced by the assessor and covers:
• the scope of the security assessment
• the system’s strengths and weaknesses
• security risks associated with the operation of the system
• the effectiveness of the implementation of controls
• any recommended remediation actions.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some key components of a security assessment report?
output:
A security assessment report includes details about the scope of the assessment, findings from the analysis, recommendations on how to improve security, and any other relevant information related to the assessment process ISM-1563. At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a security assessment report is produced by the assessor and covers:
• the scope of the security assessment
• the system’s strengths and weaknesses
• security risks associated with the operation of the system
• the effectiveness of the implementation of controls
• any recommended remediation actions.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of system specific security documents?
output: Examples include: System Security Plans (SSP), Risk Assessments, Contingency Planning Documents, Disaster Recovery Plans ISM-1564. At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a plan of action and milestones is produced by the system owner.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some actions included in a plan of action?
output: The plan should include steps such as implementing new policies or procedures, updating software, training employees on new processes, and monitoring changes over time - ISM-1564. At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a plan of action and milestones is produced by the system owner.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some actions included in a plan of action?
output: The plan should include steps such as implementing new policies or procedures, updating software, changing passwords, etc - ISM-1564. At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a plan of action and milestones is produced by the system owner.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens when I use unauthorized access?
output: When you use unauthorized access, it will be logged and your actions may result in disciplinary action or termination from employment ISM-1566. Use of unprivileged access is logged.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of privilege escalation attacks?
output: Privilege escalation attacks can include exploiting vulnerabilities in operating system or applications, gaining unauthorized access to sensitive data, denial of service attack, etc ISM-1566. Use of unprivileged access is logged.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What should be done if supplier is identified as high-risk?
output: High-risk suppliers must not be used ISM-1567. Suppliers identified as high risk by a cyber supply chain risk assessment are not used.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does security mean?
output: Security refers to measures taken to protect people or assets against harm or loss. ISM-1568. Applications, ICT equipment and services are chosen from suppliers that have demonstrated a commitment to the security of their products and services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of cyber supply chain risk management activities?
output: Shared Responsibility Model ISM-1569. A shared responsibility model is created, documented and shared between suppliers and their customers in order to articulate the security responsibilities of each party.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of managed services and cloud services?
output: Managed Services include IT infrastructure management, network monitoring, data backup and recovery, help desk support, and disaster recovery planning. Cloud services provide access to software applications over the internet without having to install them on your computer or server ISM-1570. Outsourced cloud service providers and their cloud services undergo a security assessment by an IRAP assessor at least every 24 months.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of managed services and cloud services?
output: Managed Services include IT infrastructure management, application hosting, network monitoring, data storage, help desk support, etc., while Cloud services provide access to computing resources such as servers, networks, applications, and storage over the internet on demand ISM-1571. The right to verify compliance with security requirements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of control descriptions?
output: One example of a control description would be The right to verify compliance with security requirements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers. ISM-1571. The right to verify compliance with security requirements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM Where are my data stored?
output: In the regions or availability zones specified by our contracts - ISM-1572. The regions or availability zones where data will be processed, stored and communicated is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of managed services and cloud services?
output: Managed Services include IT infrastructure management, application hosting, network monitoring, help desk support, etc., while Cloud Services provide access to computing resources such as servers, storage, databases, applications, networks, software, analytics, etc. ISM-1572. The regions or availability zones where data will be processed, stored and communicated is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some of the requirements for access to log files?
output: The organization must have a written agreement with its service provider, which should include details about how they will be able to access their logs. ISM-1573. Access to all logs relating to an organisation’s data and services is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of managed services and cloud services?
output: Managed Services include IT infrastructure management, network monitoring, help desk support, application hosting, storage management, disaster recovery planning, and more. Cloud services provide access to computing resources such as servers, networks, applications, and databases over the Internet on demand without having to invest in hardware or software. ISM-1573. Access to all logs relating to an organisation’s data and services is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of managed services and cloud services?
output: Managed Services include IT infrastructure management, network monitoring, help desk support, application hosting, server administration, desktop support, etc. Cloud services provide access to computing resources such as servers, networks, applications, and storage over the internet on demand. ISM-1574. The storage of data in a portable manner that allows for backups, service migration and service decommissioning without any loss of data is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is the minimum notice period required before terminating a service?
output: One month ISM-1575. A minimum notification period of one month for the cessation of any services by a service provider is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of managed services and cloud services?
output: Managed Services include IT infrastructure management, network monitoring, data backup and recovery, help desk support, application hosting, and more. Cloud services provide access to software applications over the internet without having to install them on your computer or server ISM-1575. A minimum notification period of one month for the cessation of any services by a service provider is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is the minimum notification period for the cessation of any services by a service provider?
output: One month ISM-1575. A minimum notification period of one month for the cessation of any services by a service provider is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can an organisation ensure continuous access to its online services in case of disasters?
output: By having multiple locations with redundant infrastructure ISM-1578. An organisation is notified by cloud service providers of any change to configured regions or availability zones for online services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does this notification mean?
output: This means that there has been a change made to the configuration settings of your online services, such as adding new servers or changing server locations ISM-1578. An organisation is notified by cloud service providers of any change to configured regions or availability zones for online services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can availability planning and monitoring help ensure continuous delivery of cloud services?
output: By ensuring that all components are monitored and alerts generated when thresholds are exceeded ISM-1579. Cloud service providers’ ability to dynamically scale resources due to a genuine spike in demand or a denial-of-service attack is tested as part of capacity planning processes for online services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can service providers ensure continuous availability of online services?
output: Service providers can ensure continuous availability of online services by using multiple servers in different locations or data centers. ISM-1580. Where a high availability requirement exists for online services, the services are architected to automatically transition between availability zones.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does continuous real-time monitoring mean?
output: It means checking and tracking the status of online services at all times, without any interruptions or delays - ISM-1581. Continuous real-time monitoring of the availability of online services is performed.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can service providers ensure continuous availability of online services?
output: Service providers can ensure continuous availability of online services by performing continuous real time monitoring of the availability of online services ISM-1581. Continuous real-time monitoring of the availability of online services is performed.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does Application Control Ruleset mean?
output: An application control rule set defines which applications can be installed and used by users of a computer system - ISM-1582. Application control rulesets are validated on an annual or more frequent basis.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does application control rule sets mean in operating systems?
output: Application Control Rule Sets refer to the set of policies used by the OS to determine which applications can run on it. ISM-1582. Application control rulesets are validated on an annual or more frequent basis.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does unprivileged mean?
output: It means not having access to certain resources and functions - ISM-1584. Unprivileged users are prevented from bypassing, disabling or modifying security functionality of operating systems.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can I change my web browser's security settings?
output: You are unable to modify your web browser’s security settings because they have been set up by administrators and cannot be modified by individual users ISM-1585. Web browser security settings cannot be changed by users.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of web browser security settings?
output: Some examples include enabling HTTPS connections, disabling Java script execution, blocking popups, etc ISM-1585. Web browser security settings cannot be changed by users.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you monitor data import and export in your system?
output: By using data transfer logs ISM-1586. Data transfer logs are used to record all data imports and exports from systems.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is data transfer log?
output: Data transfer log is a record of all data transfers between two or more systems - ISM-1586. Data transfer logs are used to record all data imports and exports from systems.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of systems that require annual reports on their security status?
output: Examples include databases containing sensitive information such as financial records or medical data ISM-1587. System owners report the security status of each system to its authorising officer at least annually.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does System owner mean?
output: The person who has responsibility for managing and maintaining a computer or network system - ISM-1587. System owners report the security status of each system to its authorising officer at least annually.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does ISM-1588 refer to in this context?
output: ISM-1588 refers to standard operating environments which are reviewed and updated at least annually ISM-1588. SOEs are reviewed and updated at least annually.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does MTA-STS stand for?
output: Message Transfer Agent - Secure Transport Service ISM-1589. MTA-STS is enabled to prevent the unencrypted transfer of emails between complying servers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does ISM-1589 MTA-STS stand for?
output: It stands for Internet Message Authentication: Mail Transfer Agent Secure Transport ISM-1589. MTA-STS is enabled to prevent the unencrypted transfer of emails between complying servers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens when credentials are changed?
output:
When credentials are changed, they will be updated with new values. ISM-1590. Credentials are changed if:
• they are directly compromised
• they are suspected of being compromised
• they appear in an online data breach database
• they are discovered stored on networks in the clear
• they are discovered being transferred across networks in the clear
• membership of a shared account changes
• they have not been changed in the past 12 months.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM When should access be restricted?
output: Access should be restricted immediately after detecting any suspicious behavior from users. - ISM-1591. Access to systems, applications and data repositories is removed or suspended as soon as practicable when personnel are detected undertaking malicious activities.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does Access to systems mean?
output: It refers to access to computer networks, servers, databases etc - ISM-1591. Access to systems, applications and data repositories is removed or suspended as soon as practicable when personnel are detected undertaking malicious activities.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does Access to systems mean?
output: It refers to access to computer networks, servers, databases, etc. - ISM-1591. Access to systems, applications and data repositories is removed or suspended as soon as practicable when personnel are detected undertaking malicious activities.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What do you understand by data repositories?
output: Data repositories are storage locations for data such as files, folders, documents, images, videos, etc. - ISM-1591. Access to systems, applications and data repositories is removed or suspended as soon as practicable when personnel are detected undertaking malicious activities.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does applications refer to?
output: Applications can be software programs such as word processors, spreadsheets, email clients, etc. - ISM-1591. Access to systems, applications and data repositories is removed or suspended as soon as practicable when personnel are detected undertaking malicious activities.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How would this control help prevent malicious activity?
output: This control helps prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data and resources which could lead to security breaches. - ISM-1591. Access to systems, applications and data repositories is removed or suspended as soon as practicable when personnel are detected undertaking malicious activities.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does unprivileged mean?
output: It means that you don't have access to certain resources or functions - ISM-1592. Unprivileged users do not have the ability to install unapproved software.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which you can prevent unauthorized installation of applications on your computer?
output: Some ways include using application whitelisting or blacklisting, restricting access to certain websites, disabling administrative privileges, etc ISM-1592. Unprivileged users do not have the ability to install unapproved software.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of sufficient evidence to verify one's identity when requesting new credentials?
output: Examples include providing proof of address or government issued ID ISM-1593. Users provide sufficient evidence to verify their identity when requesting new credentials.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens when credentials are changed?
output: When credentials are changed, they will be updated with new values and used for future requests. ISM-1595. Credentials provided to users are changed on first use.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does credential mean?
output: A credential is a secret piece of data used for authentication purposes - ISM-1596. Credentials, in the form of memorised secrets, are not reused by users across different systems.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you protect your credentials from being stolen or misused by attackers?
output: You can use strong passwords with a combination of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, special characters, and symbols. ISM-1597. Credentials are obscured as they are entered into systems.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What should an organization do to plan for cyber security risks and manage cyber security business risks within their organisation.?
output: An organization must develop a comprehensive risk management program which includes identifying threats, vulnerabilities, impact analysis, mitigation strategies, and contingency plans. ISM-1598. Following maintenance or repair activities for ICT equipment, the ICT equipment is inspected to confirm it retains its approved software configuration and that no unauthorised modifications have taken place.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does inspect mean?
output: To examine something carefully - ISM-1598. Following maintenance or repair activities for ICT equipment, the ICT equipment is inspected to confirm it retains its approved software configuration and that no unauthorised modifications have taken place.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways of handling sensitive data?
output: Sensitive data should be stored securely and only accessed by authorized personnel, with appropriate controls in place such as encryption, access control lists (ACLs), and auditing capabilities - ISM-1599. ICT equipment is handled in a manner suitable for its sensitivity or classification.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of handling ICT equipment in a manner suitable for its sensitivity or classification?
output: Examples include using proper cables when connecting devices, ensuring all ports on devices are securely closed, and keeping sensitive information out of plain sight ISM-1599. ICT equipment is handled in a manner suitable for its sensitivity or classification.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways of handling sensitive data?
output: Sensitive data should be stored securely and only accessed by authorized personnel. - ISM-1599. ICT equipment is handled in a manner suitable for its sensitivity or classification.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you sanitize media before using it for the first time?
output: You can sanitise media by cleaning with soap and water or disinfectant wipes ISM-1600. Media is sanitised before it is used for the first time.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of security documentation?
output: Examples include policies and procedures for incident handling, change management, access control, etc - ISM-1602. Security documentation, including notification of subsequent changes, is communicated to all stakeholders.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can organizations communicate security documents effectively?
output: Organizations can communicate security documents by using various methods such as email, intranet or other communication channels. ISM-1602. Security documentation, including notification of subsequent changes, is communicated to all stakeholders.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is insecure authentication method?
output: An insecure authentication method refers to any authentication process which can be easily compromised by attackers ISM-1603. Authentication methods susceptible to replay attacks are disabled.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which virtualization can help improve system performance?
output: Virtualization allows multiple operating systems to run on one machine at the same time without interfering with each other. This helps reduce costs as it eliminates the need to purchase separate machines for different applications or operating systems. ISM-1604. When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the configuration of the isolation mechanism is hardened by removing unneeded functionality and restricting access to the administrative interface used to manage the isolation mechanism.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some benefits of virtualization?
output: Virtualization allows you to run multiple operating systems on one machine at the same time. This means you can use different applications without having to buy separate computers or servers. ISM-1605. When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the underlying operating system is hardened.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does it mean when you use a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server's hardware?
output: It means that the underlying operating system is hardened - ISM-1605. When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the underlying operating system is hardened.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does it mean when you use a software based isolation mechanism to share a physical server's hardware?
output: It means applying patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities on time ISM-1606. When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities are applied to the isolation mechanism and underlying operating system in a timely manner.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does System Owners mean?
output: The people who have ownership over the system, such as administrators and managers - ISM-1609. System owners are consulted before allowing intrusion activity to continue on a system for the purpose of collecting further data or evidence.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does System owner mean?
output: The person who has ownership over a computer, network, or other device - ISM-1609. System owners are consulted before allowing intrusion activity to continue on a system for the purpose of collecting further data or evidence.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is a control?
output: A control is a method of emergency access to systems, which should be documented and tested at least once when it's first implemented and every time there are any fundamental IT infrastructure changes ISM-1610. A method of emergency access to systems is documented and tested at least once when initially implemented and each time fundamental information technology infrastructure changes occur.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some methods of emergency access to systems?
output: Some methods of emergency access to systems include: ISM-1610. A method of emergency access to systems is documented and tested at least once when initially implemented and each time fundamental information technology infrastructure changes occur.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is break glass account?
output: Break glass accounts are only used when normal authentication processes cannot be used - ISM-1611. Break glass accounts are only used when normal authentication processes cannot be used.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens when I use my break glass account?
output: When you use your break glass account, it will be logged and recorded for future reference ISM-1613. Use of break glass accounts is logged.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of emergency access to systems?
output: Examples include fire alarms, power outages or other situations where immediate action must be taken ISM-1613. Use of break glass accounts is logged.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens when break glass account credentials are changed?
output: When break glass account credentials are changed, all access to the account will be revoked and new ones must be requested from the account custodian ISM-1614. Break glass account credentials are changed by the account custodian after they are accessed by any other party.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does break glass mean?
output: It means to test the account's security when its password has been reset - ISM-1615. Break glass accounts are tested after credentials are changed.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some best practices in implementing a vulnerability disclosure program?
output: Some best practices include having clear guidelines on how to report issues, providing rewards or recognition for reporting bugs, and ensuring confidentiality when necessary ISM-1616. A vulnerability disclosure program is implemented to assist with the secure development and maintenance of products and services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is a Vulnerability Disclosure Program?
output: A vulnerability disclosure program (VDP) is implemented by organizations to help them identify, disclose, and mitigate security issues within their software or hardware systems. ISM-1616. A vulnerability disclosure program is implemented to assist with the secure development and maintenance of products and services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some responsibilities of a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)?
output: Some responsibilities of a Chief Information Security Officer include overseeing the cybersecurity program, developing policies and procedures, managing risk assessments, ensuring compliance with regulations, and providing training on information security best practices ISM-1617. The CISO regularly reviews and updates their organisation’s cyber security program to ensure its relevance in addressing cyber threats and harnessing business and cyber security opportunities.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some guidelines for cyber security roles?
output: 1) Overseeing the cyber security program, 2) Regularly reviewing and updating your organization's cyber security program, 3) Ensuring it addresses cyber threats and harnesses business and cyber security opportunities - ISM-1617. The CISO regularly reviews and updates their organisation’s cyber security program to ensure its relevance in addressing cyber threats and harnessing business and cyber security opportunities.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some guidelines for developing a cybersecurity policy?
output: Some guidelines for developing a cybersecurity policy include ensuring it aligns with your company's mission statement, defining clear roles and responsibilities, establishing processes for reviewing and updating policies as needed, and making sure all employees understand what they need to know about the policy ISM-1617. The CISO regularly reviews and updates their organisation’s cyber security program to ensure its relevance in addressing cyber threats and harnessing business and cyber security opportunities.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some guidelines for cybersecurity roles?
output: 1) Ensure all employees have adequate training on cybersecurity best practices, including how to identify and report suspicious activity; 2) Establish clear policies regarding data handling procedures; 3) Implement strong password management protocols - ISM-1618. The CISO oversees their organisation’s response to cyber security incidents.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some responsibilities of a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)?
output: Some responsibilities of a Chief Information Security Officer include developing policies and procedures related to information security, managing risk assessments, conducting audits on existing systems, and ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations ISM-1618. The CISO oversees their organisation’s response to cyber security incidents.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) do?
output: A CISO oversees their organization's response to cybersecurity incidents and ensures compliance with relevant regulations ISM-1618. The CISO oversees their organisation’s response to cyber security incidents.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you disable or remove windows powershell 2.0 in windows operating systems?
output: You can disable or remove windows powershell by using the command sc config mpsession start=disabled. ISM-1621. Windows PowerShell 2.0 is disabled or removed.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does Constrained Language Mode mean?
output: It means that all commands must be written using only valid PowerShell syntax - ISM-1622. PowerShell is configured to use Constrained Language Mode.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you configure PowerShell to use constrained language mode?
output: You can configure PowerShell to use constrained language mode by using the -CommandMode parameter with the Set-ExecutionPolicy cmdlet ISM-1622. PowerShell is configured to use Constrained Language Mode.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does Constrained Language Mode mean?
output: It means that only certain commands are allowed, and all other commands will be ignored - ISM-1622. PowerShell is configured to use Constrained Language Mode.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some features of PowerShell?
output: PowerShell has several useful features including module logging, script block logging and transcription functionality ISM-1623. PowerShell is configured to use module logging, script block logging and transcription functionality.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which you can configure PowerShell to log its activities?
output: PowerShell can be configured to log its activities by using module logging, script block logging and transcription functionality ISM-1623. PowerShell is configured to use module logging, script block logging and transcription functionality.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you protect your PowerShell scripts from being logged in event viewer?
output: You can use the -NoLog parameter when running the command ISM-1624. PowerShell script block logs are protected by Protected Event Logging functionality.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some of the benefits of implementing a trusted insider program?
output: Implementing a trusted insider program can help reduce security risks by limiting access to sensitive data only to those who need it for their job functions. ISM-1625. A trusted insider program is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of a trusted insider program?
output: Examples include: ISM-1625. A trusted insider program is developed, implemented and maintained.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some best practices when developing a trusted insider program?
output: The first step in creating a trusted insider program is to identify what data will need protection. Next, it's important to determine who has access to this information and how they can use it. Finally, you must decide on the appropriate level of monitoring required to ensure compliance with your policies. ISM-1626. Legal advice is sought regarding the development and implementation of a trusted insider program.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some considerations when developing a trusted insider program?
output: When creating a trusted insider program, it's important to take into account factors such as employee privacy concerns, legal compliance requirements, and security risks associated with employees having access to sensitive data. ISM-1626. Legal advice is sought regarding the development and implementation of a trusted insider program.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does this control do?
output: This control blocks incoming traffic from anonymous networks, such as Tor and VPNs, to prevent malicious actors from accessing sensitive data on Internet facing systems ISM-1627. Inbound network connections from anonymity networks to internet-facing services are blocked.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you block anonymous inbound network connection on your firewall?
output: You can use IP address filtering or DNS blacklisting to prevent access to certain websites ISM-1627. Inbound network connections from anonymity networks to internet-facing services are blocked.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is the purpose of selecting a modulus when using DH for agreeing on encryption session keys?
output: The purpose of selecting a modulus when using DH for agreeing on encryption session keys is to ensure that the key generated by both parties will match so they can use it to encrypt data securely ISM-1629. When using DH for agreeing on encryption session keys, a modulus and associated parameters are selected according to NIST SP 800-56A Rev. 3.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is the purpose of generating a modulus when using DSA for digital signatures?
output: The purpose of generating a modulus when using DSA for digital signatures is to ensure that the signature can only be verified by someone who has access to the private key used in signing it ISM-1630. When using DSA for digital signatures, a modulus and associated parameters are generated according to FIPS 186-4.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What applications should be used for choosing suppliers?
output: Supply chain management software can help you choose suppliers based on factors such as cost, quality, reliability, and more. ISM-1632. Applications, ICT equipment and services are chosen from suppliers that have a strong track record of transparency and maintaining the security of their own systems and cyber supply chains.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What applications should be used for choosing suppliers?
output: Supply chain management software can help you choose suppliers based on factors such as cost, quality, reliability, and environmental impact ISM-1632. Applications, ICT equipment and services are chosen from suppliers that have a strong track record of transparency and maintaining the security of their own systems and cyber supply chains.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of types of systems?
output: Examples include: ISM-1633. System owners determine the type, value and security objectives for each system based on an assessment of the impact if it were to be compromised.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of controls used by system owners to protect systems and their resources?
output: Examples include access control, data encryption, network segmentation, etc ISM-1634. System owners select controls for each system and tailor them to achieve desired security objectives.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of controls that can be used by system owners to protect systems and their resources?
output: Examples include access control, data encryption, network segmentation, etc ISM-1635. System owners implement controls for each system and its operating environment.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of control descriptions?
output: Examples include ensuring systems are configured securely, monitoring access logs, implementing strong authentication mechanisms, etc ISM-1636. System owners ensure controls for each system and its operating environment are assessed to determine if they have been implemented correctly and are operating as intended.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does it mean by systems?
output: Systems refer to any hardware or software used in performing tasks such as computers, servers, networks etc ISM-1636. System owners ensure controls for each system and its operating environment are assessed to determine if they have been implemented correctly and are operating as intended.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of managed services and cloud services?
output: Managed Services include IT infrastructure management, network monitoring, data backup and recovery, help desk support, and disaster recovery planning. Cloud services provide access to software applications over the internet without having to install them locally ISM-1637. An outsourced cloud service register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some of the benefits of using an outsourced cloud service registry?
output: Outsourcing your cloud services can help you save time and money by allowing you to focus on other areas of your business while still maintaining control over your data. ISM-1637. An outsourced cloud service register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some of the benefits of using an outsourced cloud service?
output:
Outsourcing your IT services can help you save time and money, as well as improve efficiency by allowing you to focus on core business activities. ISM-1638. An outsourced cloud service register contains the following for each outsourced cloud service:
• cloud service provider’s name
• cloud service’s name
• purpose for using the cloud service
• sensitivity or classification of data involved
• due date for the next security assessment of the cloud service
• contractual arrangements for the cloud service
• point of contact for users of the cloud service
• 24/7 contact details for the cloud service provider.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of managed services and cloud services?
output:
Managed Services include IT infrastructure management, network monitoring, help desk support, application hosting, storage management, disaster recovery planning, and more. Cloud services provide access to software applications over the internet on demand without having to install them locally. ISM-1638. An outsourced cloud service register contains the following for each outsourced cloud service:
• cloud service provider’s name
• cloud service’s name
• purpose for using the cloud service
• sensitivity or classification of data involved
• due date for the next security assessment of the cloud service
• contractual arrangements for the cloud service
• point of contact for users of the cloud service
• 24/7 contact details for the cloud service provider.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does labelled mean?
output: Labelled means marked with words or symbols - ISM-1640. Cables for foreign systems installed in Australian facilities are labelled at inspection points.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some methods used in data destruction?
output: Some methods used in data destruction include shredding, degaussing, incineration, pulverization, and crushing ISM-1641. Following the use of a degausser, magnetic media is physically damaged by deforming any internal platters.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does deformed mean?
output: Deformation refers to physical damage caused on magnetic media when it has been exposed to strong magnets or electromagnetic fields - ISM-1641. Following the use of a degausser, magnetic media is physically damaged by deforming any internal platters.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you sanitize media before reuse?
output: You can sanitise media by wiping or degaussing it using approved methods ISM-1642. Media is sanitised before it is reused in a different security domain.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are software registers used for in system management?
output: Software registers are used to keep track of version numbers and patch history of various components such as application, driver, OS and firmware ISM-1643. Software registers contain versions and patch histories of applications, drivers, operating systems and firmware.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are software registers?
output: Software registers contain versions and patch histories of applications, drivers, operating systems and firmware ISM-1643. Software registers contain versions and patch histories of applications, drivers, operating systems and firmware.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What precautions should be taken when conducting sensitive or classified phone calls?
output: When conducting sensitive or classified phone calls, it's important to take steps to ensure your conversation cannot be overheard by others. This includes avoiding public places and using headphones if necessary. ISM-1644. Sensitive or classified phone calls are not conducted in public locations unless care is taken to reduce the chance of conversations being overheard.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does Floor Plan Diagrams mean?
output: A floor plan diagram shows the layout of a building or room with dimensions and other details such as furniture placement ISM-1645. Floor plan diagrams are developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of cabling infrastructures?
output:
Some examples of cabling infrastructures include copper cables, fiber optics, wireless networks, and power lines ISM-1646. Floor plan diagrams contain the following:

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of suspending access to systems or services?
output: Examples include disabling accounts, revoking permissions, locking out users from accessing certain areas, etc ISM-1647. Privileged access to systems and applications is automatically disabled after 12 months unless revalidated.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens if privilege access isn't re-enabled within 12 months?
output: The user will be unable to log into any system or application until their privileges are manually restored by an administrator ISM-1647. Privileged access to systems and applications is automatically disabled after 12 months unless revalidated.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens if my privilege is not used for more than 45 days?
output: Your privilege will be automatically disabled. ISM-1648. Privileged access to systems and applications is automatically disabled after 45 days of inactivity.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of suspending access to systems or services?
output: Examples include disabling accounts, locking out users from accessing certain areas, restricting access to specific data, etc ISM-1648. Privileged access to systems and applications is automatically disabled after 45 days of inactivity.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which privilege can be managed on a system?
output: Privileges can be managed by using just-in-time administration or least privilege. ISM-1649. Just-in-time administration is used for administering systems and applications.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is just-in-time administration?
output: Just-in-time administration is used for administering systems and applications ISM-1649. Just-in-time administration is used for administering systems and applications.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What type of event is logged?
output: Privileged account and group management events - ISM-1650. Privileged account and group management events are logged.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM Where can I find privileged access event logs?
output: They are stored on the central server - ISM-1651. Privileged access event logs are stored centrally.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM Where can I find privileged access event logs?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does it mean when a privileged account is restricted?
output: A privileged account is restricted if it cannot access certain resources such as the Internet or email. ISM-1653. Privileged service accounts are prevented from accessing the internet, email and web services.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some ways in which you can secure your computer against malware attacks?
output: Some ways to secure your computer from malware include using antivirus software, keeping all applications up to date, avoid downloading files from untrusted sources, use strong passwords, and keep your firewall enabled ISM-1654. Internet Explorer 11 is disabled or removed.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can application control be implemented on non-internet facing servers?
output: Non internet facing servers are protected by implementing application controls such as restricting access to certain applications or services based on user identity ISM-1656. Application control is implemented on non-internet-facing servers.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does application control do?
output: It restricts the execution of executable files, software libraries, scripts, installers, compiled HTML, HTML apps and control panel applets to an organization approved list ISM-1657. Application control restricts the execution of executables, software libraries, scripts, installers, compiled HTML, HTML applications and control panel applets to an organisation-approved set.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of application controls?
output: Some examples of application controls include: ISM-1657. Application control restricts the execution of executables, software libraries, scripts, installers, compiled HTML, HTML applications and control panel applets to an organisation-approved set.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does application control do?
output: It restricts the execution of drivers to an organization-approved set - ISM-1658. Application control restricts the execution of drivers to an organisation-approved set.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does 'Microsoft's recommended driver block rules' mean?
output: It means that all drivers should be blocked from accessing certain websites and services, such as social media or gaming sites ISM-1659. Microsoft’s ‘recommended driver block rules’ are implemented.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is application control?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is multi-factor authentication?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of multi-factor authentication?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is multi-factor authentication?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does multi-factor authentication do?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM Can privileged accounts access backups?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some best practices for data backup and restoration?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some best practices for data backup and restoration?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can you secure your WiFi network from unauthorized users?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What does ISM-1712 mean in wireless networking?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is a removable media register?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM Where can I find unprivileged access event logs?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens when you suspend access to a system?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is a'security.txt' file?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is media destruction?
output: Media Destruction refers to the process of destroying data stored on various types of storage medium such as hard drives, CD's, DVD's etc., so that it cannot be accessed by unauthorized users ISM-1722. instruction: In the ACSC ISM What media destruction method can be used to destroy magnetic floppy disks?
output: Magnetic floppies can be destroyed using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill, disintegrator, degausser or by cutting ISM-1723. Magnetic floppy disks are destroyed using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill, disintegrator, degausser or by cutting.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is magnetic hard disk destruction method?
output: Magnetic hard disks are destroyed by using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill, disintegrator, grinder/sander or degausser ISM-1724. Magnetic hard disks are destroyed using a furnace/incinerator, hammer mill, disintegrator, grinder/sander or degausser.

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What media destruction method can be used to destroy magnetic tape?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What media destruction method can be used to destroy optical discs?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can semiconductor memory be destroyed?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some media destruction methods?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is a software bill of materials (SBOM)?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What is the control?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can organizations respond to cybersecurity incidents?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM How can organizations respond to cybersecurity incidents?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens if requests for privileged access to data repositories are not validated?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What happens if privileged access to data repositories isn't revalidated?

instruction: In the ACSC ISM What are some examples of faulty or damaged media that cannot be successfully sanitized?
